When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training in credit and health.

In the photograph, Señora Deysi is not present because she was in the medical clinic.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, etc., for her store.

loans.name: La Semillita Group

texts.es: Karen tiene 19 años de edad y es originaria una comunidad llamada la venta ella nada mas pudo estudiar hasta el 3° año de preparatoria y dice que dejo de estudiar por falta de recursos ya que son mas hermanos los cuales también estudian la secundaria y la primaria, es por eso que ella emprendió el negocio de la venta de blancos por catalogo, dice que le vende a sus amigas y conocidas que sabe que si pagan ya que vende en pagos. Dice que ahorita ella esta pidiendo un crédito a Visión Fund para comprar colchas, edredones, sabanas, cobijas, cortinas, toallas que tiene como pedidos por parte de sus clientas, también dice que va a venderle a maestras de su comunidad ya que tienen un trabajo estable y le pagan cada quincena, platica que a diario sale a vender sus blancos y que está orgullosa de tener su propio negocio ya que ella espera juntar dinero para pagar el siguiente año la colegiatura ya que quiere estudiar y trabajar. Los otros nueve integrantes del grupo se llaman María Balbina, Rosa, María Isabel, María Santos, Edith, José David, María Guadalupe, Diana y Rosa María ellos invertirán sus créditos en diferentes actividades económicas que ellos tienen como tienda de ropa para dama, caballeros y niños, en zapato por catalogo, compra de frituras, dulces, refrescos para su venta, para surtir material para estética unisex, para accesorios y refacciones para teléfonos celulares, artículos para surtir tienda de abarrotes, para joyería de fantasía para su venta, para colchas, sabanas por catalogo, etc.
texts.en: Karen is 19 years old and is an original member of the community called "la venta".  She was only able to study until third grade as she lacked the resources due to her family having other children who were also studying.  This is why she started her business of selling home items from a catalog.  She sells the items to her friends and acquaintances because she trusts them to pay the installment plan of her business.  She is currently seeking a loan from Vision Fund to purchase quilts, comforters, sheets, blankets, curtains, and towels on behalf of her customers' demands.  She also plans to sell to the teachers of her community because they have stable jobs and are paid twice per month.  She goes out daily to sell her products and she is very proud of having her own business that generates money so she can pay to continue her studies.  The other nine members of the group are María Balbina, Rosa, María Isabel, María Santos, Edith, José David, María Guadalupe, Diana and Rosa.  They will invest their loans in their respective businesses such as clothing for men, women, and children, a shoe catalog, fried goods, candy, beverages, unisex clothing material, phone accessories, items for a small grocery, and jewelry.

loans.use: to purchase house items such as quilts, comforters, sheets, blankets, curtains, towels etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, 51, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Erlinda operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, and dahlias plus a variety of hanging plants and other items. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the nearby community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and garden inputs for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Erlinda dreams of growing her business in the coming years and hopes to live a peaceful life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and garden inputs

loans.name: Las Naranjitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS NARANJITAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Kathia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de artesanía, tejido de material de alpaca, venta de edredones, chocolatería, venta de regalos de matrimonio, confección de calzados, venta de cinta de embalaje, venta de cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Kathia es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa.  En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio elaboración de chocolates, aprendiendo este técnica con ayuda de su madre.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de chocolates) que adquirirá de los tiendas por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación, crédito y salud.

En la fotografía no esta presente la señora María Elena por razones culturales.
texts.en:
The “LAS NARANJITAS” community association is starting its first cycle in “Pro Mujer,” as part of the Santiago II Central Office.  The group is made up of eight members and governed by a board of directors.  Kathia is the group’s president.  The businesses that the members run include art sales, alpaca yarn weaving, quilt sales, chocolates, wedding gifts, shoe making, packaging tape sales, and cosmetic sales.

This loan will help small businesses like Kathia’s; she is beginning her second cycle as a “Pro Mujer” member.  She joined after being invited by a promoter who visited her home.  She has a chocolate making business, having learned the art from her mother.
 
This loan will increase her working capital and she will buy chocolates in quantity from stores, and resell them from her point of sale.  This job allows her to generate income to support her family; she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training, loans, and health benefits.
 
María Elena is not in the photograph for cultural reasons.

loans.use: to buy chocolate.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 28 years old, married and has two infant-age children. With her husband, she aims to become financially stable so that they can educate their children and give them a better future. While she takes care of her kids, she also manages a small variety store in their community to help her husband generate income. She aims to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demands but due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional PHP 10,000 to buy candies, biscuits, canned goods, noodles, soaps, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to sell. She believes that this loan will be a great help to improve the business and hopes that someday, it will grow and become a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy candies, biscuits, canned goods, noodles, soaps, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Asi

texts.en: Asi lives with her husband who is a farmer and four children at Jukwa near Abura. Asi extracts palm oil and palm kennel oil to sell. She has been in this business for 15 years now. She uses her income to assist her husband with the general upkeep of their children. Asi will use her loan to purchase palm fruit and kernels to enable her to produce oil to sell.  With the new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase palm fruit and kernels

loans.name: Nueva Realidad Group

texts.es: Doña Lidia tiene 47 años de edad y es originaria de una localidad llamada Curungueo, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos los cuales estudian una la secundaria y el otro la primaria, ella es parte del grupo llamado Nueva Realidad y dice que le pusieron ese nombre a su grupo por que iba hacer otra vida atravez de los créditos ya que ha mejorado mucho su estabilidad económica y sus negocios. Ella se dedica desde hace mas de 20 años a la compra venta de ropa para dama, caballeros y niños, dice que va a surtirse a la ciudad de México y a Toluca ya que ahí encuentra precios económicos a los cuales ella después les puede ganar algo, dice que comenzó el negocio para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y para la educación de sus hijos, ella esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de ropa como playeras para caballero, pantalones de mezclilla para dama, blusas, trajecitos de pants y chamarra, conjuntos para niños, short, playeritas etc. Dice que vende su  ropa en pagos a clientas que les tiene la confianza y que tienen un trabajo estable con el cual puedan pagar rápido y no quedarle mal, dice que su meta es también vender zapatos por catalogo y accesorios para dama como pulseras, aretes, collares y diademas de pedrería fina. Dice que desde que entro a trabajar a Visión Fund su negocio a mejorado mucho ya que a través de los créditos a podido comprar ropa de mejor calidad para vender. Los otros tres integrantes del grupo son Angelica, Francisco y Maria Raquel ellos invertirán sus créditos en su negocio de ropa de segunda, en la compra de insumos para elaborar antojitos mexicanos que vende y para surtir colchas y perfumes por catalogo.
texts.en:
Lidia is 47 years old and comes from Curungueo.  She is married and has 2 children, one who is in high school and the other is in elementary.  Lidia is part of a group called Nueva Realidad ( New Meaning ) and says the group obtained its name because it would create new meaning through the loans and they have helped improve and stabilize her economic standing along with her business.  Lidia has been buying and selling clothing for more than 20 years ranging from women's clothing, men and children's clothing and she states she purchases in Mexico and Toluca because she gets more competitive pricing and can later recover a profit.  She states that she started the business in order to help her husband with the household expenses and the children's education.  She asking for the loan to purchase clothes like: men's shirts, women's jeans, blouses, suits, children's sets, shorts, shirts, etc.. She allows installments to clients she trusts and knows they have a steady income from which they can pay from quickly and not default.  She also has a goal of selling shoes through catalog and women's accessories like: bracelets, earrings, necklaces, and hairbands decorated with fine stones.  Since she began working with Vision Fund her business has improved due to the loans allowing her to purchase better quality clothing to sell.  
The other three members of the group are: Angelica, Francisco, and Maria Raquel who will invest their loans towards their businesses of selling second-hand clothing, purchasing consumables to make mexican snacks, and to stock on catalog sheets and perfumes.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for women, men, children, men shirts, women's jeans, blouses, suits, kid's clothing, shorts, shirts, etc..

loans.name: Abasolo Group

texts.es: Karla tiene 21 años de edad y esta estudiando el primer año para abogada en su natal Zitacuaro, platica que escogió esa carrera por que se le hace interesante el ayudar a las demás personas, ella es parte del grupo Abasolo y dice que llamaron así a su grupo por el nombre del lugar donde viven. Comenta que desde un año empezó con el negocio de la venta por catalogo de zapatos y ropa para poder ayudar a sus padres a pagar su  escuela, también dice que entre semana le ayuda a su  mama a la venta de menudo en el mercado de su población y los domingos afuera de su casa. Ella es soltera pero desde muy chica le ayuda a su mama con los quehaceres de la casa y con sus hermanos que son 3, ella es una chica dedicada y con ganas de salir adelante es por eso que ella esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para surtir ropa y  zapatos que tiene pendientes y que sus clientes le han encargado, ella espera con mucho entusiasmo que le siga yendo bien en su negocio para asi poder aportar un poco mas a su casa y asi ayudar a sus padres. Los otros 7 integrantes del grupo se llaman Ma. Rocío, Ma. Concepción, Teresa, Aída, María de los Ángeles, Victoria y Jorge ellos invertirán sus créditos en diferentes actividades económicas como en diferentes dulces para surtir un puesto, en refacciones para carro, en globos para vender, en ropa para dama para vender, en diferentes marcas de zapato por catalogo y  en comprar elotes para coserlos y venderlos preparados.
texts.en:
Karla is 21 years old and is in her first year of law school in her native city, Zitacuaro.  She tells us that she chose this career because she is interested in helping other people.  She is part of the 'Abasolo' group and says that that the group is called this because of the name of the place where they live.  She says that a year ago she started a business selling shoes and clothing from catalogs to be able to help her parents pay for her school.  She also says that during the week she helps her mother once in a while at her town's market, and on Sundays outside of her house.

She is single, but since she was very small she has helped her mother with the household chores and with her 3 brothers.  She is a dedicated girl, with a desire to get ahead.  It is because of that that she is requesting a loan to supply clothing and shoes to have ready, and that her clients have already ordered.  She waits enthusiastically for her business to continue to go well to then be able to contribute a little more to her house and help her parents.

The other 7 members of the group are named Rocío, Concepción, Teresa, Aída, María de los Ángeles, Victoria and Jorge.  They will invest their loans in different businesses, like in different sweets to supply a stall, for car repairs, for balloons to sell, in womens' clothing to sell, in different brands of clothing from a catalog and to buy corncobs to sew them and sell them when done.

loans.use: to buy different brands of clothing and shoes by catalog to sell.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: Marcelino ha sido agricultor prácticamente toda su vida, desde pequeño ayudaba a su padre a trabajar en el campo y tiene mucha experiencia en distintos tipos de cultivos. Él está casado con Irma y tienen 7 hijos quienes lo ayudan a trabajar en sus parcelas en la temporada de vacaciones pues aún están estudiando. Marcelino nos cuenta que durante la cosecha pasada no tuvo una muy buena producción debido a que las condiciones climatológicas no fueron las ideales para el café, sin embargo este año sabe que será mucho mejor. Para la siguiente cosecha Marcelino solicita un crédito para poder pagar a los jornaleros que lo ayudaran en las tareas de corte de café. Además de producir café Marcelino también se dedica a la producción de caña, limón y miel, actividades que le ayudan a tener un mejor ingreso para la economía familiar. A Marcelino le gustaría en un futuro poder ampliar su casa pues su familia es numerosa y de esta manera podrán vivir mas cómodamente.
texts.en:
Marcelino has been a farmer practically all of his life.  He used to help his father in the fields when he was a boy and he has lots of experience with all types of crops.  He’s married to Irma and they have seven children who help him do his work on his land during their vacations, as they still attend school.

Marcelino says that his previous harvest was not very good, because the climate was not ideal for coffee, however this year it will be much better.  He is asking for this loan so that he can hire field hands who will help him with the next coffee harvest.

Aside from raising coffee, he also raises sugar cane, lemon, and honey.  This helps him increase his family income.  He would like to enlarge his home in the future because he has a large family and it would allow them to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to hire field hands.

loans.name: Munga

texts.en: Munga is a hardworking man who has a small business. He drives his own motorcycle, providing service in the rural area of Samburu. His wife sells fish from their home. Through their work, they can cover the house expenses. Munga wants to expand his business, which he says is doing very well as most people prefer a motorcycle taxi because most places have inaccessible roads. He has not had more problems and has managed to keep working with his taxi. Since this is his way of life, he has to provide good maintenance to his taxi, taking care of his life and the passengers as well. Munga wants to purchase a new motorcycle using the requested loan.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Deus

texts.en: Deus is a 58-year-old married man with five children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been dealing in agricultural produce for five years. The gentle man faces problems of inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand and seasonal nature of the business. He has personal goals of educating his children and building a permanent house, as they are currently living under a wattled mud house. His business goal is to buy land to grow crops. Deus is requesting a loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en: Lorie is married and a mother of six dependents. She is 55 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Clarin. Lorie owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. She established the motorcycle transport business as a way of generating extra income of 9,600 PHP per month. She has been engaged in this type of service for 25 years. Lorie requested a loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories. Lorie has been a good member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Lorie wants to purchase more motorcycles to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia sells salt and onions at Jukwa, near Abura, which she has done for 3 years now. She is married and has 4 children. She uses her income to support the husband in paying their children’s school fees. Cythia will use her loan to puchase bags of salt and onions to sell.  With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: puchase bags of salt and onions to sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience sells salt at Jukwa near Abura which she has done for six years now. She is married and has four children. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  Patience will use her loan to purchase bags of salt to sell. With the additional profit, she will expand her business

loans.use: purchase bags of salt to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 25-year-old hardworking man living in Kyenjojo,Uganda. He ventured into the beauty salon business which is shunned by most men as they think it is work for women. But Peter says he has reaped a lot of profits from the service. With the income earned, he has been able to pay school fees for his young brothers and sisters. Peter started this business after dropping out of school because he was unable to pay school fees. He then started trading in maize which helped him get capital for the salon. He has a problem of inadequate capital to buy wholesale. He has personal goal of building his residential house and expanding his business into new market areas. Peter is requesting for a loan to buy a hair drying machine.

loans.use: to buy a hair drying machine.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells tubers of yams at Jukwa. She has been in this business for 20 years. Ekua is a single parent and has four children. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children and pay their fees. Ekua needs this loan to enable her to buy more yam tubers to sell. With the additional profit, Ekua will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more tubers of yams to sell.

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.en: Arlinda is 59 years old and married. She is from Sebasi, Clarin. She has eight grown children who have helped her take care of her coconut crop. Arlinda has been raising coconuts for 25 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Arlinda joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and to pay weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay weeding costs.

loans.name: Evarcate

texts.en: Evarcate is a single mother of one child living in Hioma, Uganda. She owns a nursery school and she is so hardworking and devoted to what she is doing. She also supplements her school with farming since the income she gets from the school is paid termly. She is challenged by inadequate capital to buy the necessary equipment for the school and by price fluctuations of agricultural products. Her personal goal is to educate her children and upgrade in her studies while her dream is to venture into mechanized farming practices. Evarcate is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and pay workers who are ploughing her garden.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay workers who are ploughing her garden.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 45 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis, Occidental. She is married and has one child. Josephine plants and harvests rice to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns 4,500 PHP per month. She joined GDMPC this year to gain financial access to help improve her business. She has applied for a loan of 5,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. Josephine plans to use the additional profits earned to reinvest in the business and she will also use a portion to meet the family's basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Efia

texts.en: Efia sells vegetable like garden-eggs at Jukwa market near Abura. She has been selling vegetables for 6 years now. Efia has 4 children and so uses her income to feed and clothe her children. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of vegetables like tomatoes, garden-eggs (eggplant-like glossy vegetables), pepper for sale. With the new profit, she wishes to mount a stall for the sale of her vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables like tomatoes, garden-eggs, pepper for sale

loans.name: John Wilson

texts.en: John Wilson is a forty-eight-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a vision of educating his children up to university level. He has been running an auto garage and spare parts business for thirteen years. He is facing hardships due to price fluctuations and inflation, customers not paying on time and high transportation costs. He has a vision of hiring employees to help expand his business. John Wilson intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
This is Janeth, 36. She is resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ramil, a sales operator, and is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Janeth is in a hardware business. She buys coco lumber from a big coco lumber company and then retails it with a small income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the nearby communities. She earns a minimum of 8,000 Philippines pesos (Php) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stock of coco lumber for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Janeth dreams to grow her business in the coming years and hopes to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stock of coco lumber needed in her business.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is a seamstress and also bakes meat pies for sale. She is married to a teacher and has one child. She has been sewing for 15 years now. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their accommodation bills. 

Esi makes dresses for sale, so she needs a loan to purchase fabrics for the dresses she makes. She will also use some of the loan to purchase flour and other ingredients to bake her meat pies for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for the dresses she makes and to purchase flour and other ingredients to bake meat pies for sale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama sells tubers of yams. She has displayed her yam for sale at the Jukwa Market near Abura. She has been in this business for 13 years now. Ama is married to a farmer and has 1 child. She uses her income to support her husband and to feed, clothe and pay school fees for her child.

Ama needs this loan to enable her to buy more tubers of yams to sell. With the new profits, Ama will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more tubers of yams to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is from Panay Daku, Clarin. She is 43 years old, married and has five children. Nancy plants, harvests and sells bananas to earn a living and has been in the business for 12 years. She usually earns 8,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Nancy joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 9,500 PHP which will be used to purchase farming chemicals. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase farming chemicals for growing bananas.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is divorced and has 5 children. She sells vegetables such as tomatoes, gardeneggs, onions  and other food items at Jukwa Market near Abura. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children as well as pay their school fees. 

Afia will use her loan to purchase a variety of vegetables to satisfy her customers. With the new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
This is Rosana, 46, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Cleto, a driver, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Rosana oversees operations of their jeepney* transportation business. She has one, 14-16 person capacity, jeepney for which she is paid boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1000 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosana dreams to have another jeepney and hopes to give her children a good quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her work every week and where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers in helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney: open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

** All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of their jeepney.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is from Malibangcao, Clarin. She is 34 years old, married and has three children. To earn a living, Naomi has run a general store for 13 years and earns 9,000 PHP a month from it. In 2009, Naomi joined GDMPC. Naomi is requesting a loan of 14,500 PHP, which will be used to buy more canned goods, milk, soap and spices to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, milk, soap and spices to sell.

loans.name: Sana'a

texts.en: Sana'a is a 35-year-old married woman from Jarash Jordan who supports 3 family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to buy foodstuffs to resell in her small store behind her home. In the future she hopes to increase her products to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to resell

loans.name: Magret

texts.en: Magret is a forty-year-old married woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. After realizing that her husband alone could not support the family needs she decided to start a business dealing in secondhand shoes and has since reaped tangible benefits. She is so hardworking that she operates the business ten hours per day and she got startup capital from her husband. With the income earned she has been able to pay school fees for her children and also help her husband to build their residential house. Like all good mothers she dreams of educating her children up to the University and her business desire is to expand to new market areas despite challenges of high competition and inadequate capital. Magret is requesting a loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 26 years old and single. He has been operating a mobile accessories business for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 11,000.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Timothy will use the loan to buy more mobile accessories for his business. 

With the anticipated profit he will expand his business. His hopes and dreams are to expand the business and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy more mobile accessories for his business

loans.name: Perebeth

texts.en: Perebeth lives in Bañadero, Ozamis City. She has earned a living through providing transportation services for 3 years. She gets an income of 12,000 PHP a month for this business. Without hesitation, Perebeth is borrowing the amount of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to repair the transport vehicle used in her business. She joined GDMPC in 2011. Her plan for the future is to hopefully improve her business.

loans.use: to repair the transport vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 48 years old, married and blessed with three children that she supports. She is a maize farmer in Narok and has been in farming for the past 15 years. Her monthly income is KES 30,000. 

She is going for her third loan from KADET LTD of KES 60,000, that she will use to buy farm inputs and prepare the land.

She intends to use anticipated profits to reinvest.  Her future dream is to be successful in her venture.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and prepare the land

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena is a 43-year-old business lady. She is married to Isaac, a businessman. They are blessed with five children. She has been running a retail shop for the past twelve years with the monthly income of KES 5,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her fourth loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Lena will use the loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice and maize meal to sell.


With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice and maize meal

loans.name: Lidia Dinora

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 38 años de edad, vive con sus dos hijos menores. Se dedica al comercio informal de panes, tamales, entre otros productos alimenticios. Desde muy pequeña se dedica a esta actividad, debido a que sus padres eran muy humildes y trabajaban es esta actividad para obtener ingresos para su familia de una forma digna y honrada. Hoy en día ella comenta que se siente muy orgullosa de su trabajo y enseña a sus hijos también esa forma de vida.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 5 sacos de fertilizantes y para pago de mano de obra para limpiar su cultivo de maíz antes de fertilizarlo. Por razones económicas Lidia, no puede comprar las cosas que necesita de una sola vez; pero con el préstamo tendrá esa oportunidad y podrá trabajar mejor. De esta manera, garantizara el alimento para su familia y si es posible poder comercializar maíz obteniendo un ingreso extra.  Ella desea continuar trabajando, enseñarles a sus hijos el valor de la vida.
texts.en:
Lidia is 38 years old and lives with her two underage children. She informally sells bread and tamales, among other food products. She is doing this since she was very young, because her parents were humble and worked in this line of work in order to obtain income for their family in a honorable and honest way. Today she feels proud  of her work and also teaches her children to live this way.

The loan she is requesting to Fundación Campo, is to buy 5 bags of fertilizers and to pay the needed workforce for cleaning her corn field before spreading the fertilizers. Because of economic reasons, Lidia cannot buy the things she needs all at once, but with the loan she will be able to do so and to work in a better way. In this way, she will guarantee food for her family and if possible, an extra income by selling corn. She wants to continue working and teach her children the value of life.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of fertilizer and to pay the workforce needed in order to clean her corn field.

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Kayi mariée à un instituteur vit avec ce dernier et leurs enfants qui sont sur les bancs d’école à Lomé.  En 2004, elle a commencé par vendre du charbon de bois, de la farine à la maison. Avec ce premier prêt qu’elle sollicite à WAGES, elle va acheter des charbons de bois. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle veut multiplier des points de vente et si possible avoir un magasin de charbon de bois tout en assurant les besoins primaires de la famille.
texts.en: Kayi is married to a primary school teacher and lives with him and their children who attend school in Lomé. In 2004 she began selling charcoal and flour from home. With this first loan she is requesting from WAGES she is going to buy charcoal. Her ambition for the future is to multiply her sales outlets and, if possible, to have a charcoal shop, as well as providing for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Ferial

texts.en: Ferial is a 42-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan, who supports 5 family members. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to pay for her daughter's university tuition. In the past Ferial was selling clothes and blankets from Aqaba, and now she would like an education loan. In the future she hopes to open a project for sewing to increase her family income.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 31-year-old single man, who has worked as a Blacksmith for the past 18 years. He is well known in his area for his good reputation and the special customer care he provides.
Abbass doesn't have his own working area; he uses his car as his mobile working shop, where he has all his necessary tools and machines. Howerver it became very risky and needs to be changed, because of its numerous mechanical problems.
Abbass applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new car necessary to keep his business going and improving.
Abbass's customers are from different regions since he is not located in one specialized place. He hopes to keep on improving his business, increasing his customers and expanding his working zone.

loans.use: To buy a new car to use as his mobile workshop

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, 53, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nemrod and is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Nenita is in the Arts business. She makes sand mosaics which are an affordable wall decor. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She also makes mosaics to order. She earns a minimum of Php 4500 every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy sand, glue, patterns, plastics and other materials needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nenita dreams of expanding her business and hopes to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, which is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for sand, glue, patterns, plastics and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Adjowavi

texts.fr: Adjowavi est âgée de 30ans. Elle a pour mari un transitaire et n’a pas pour le moment des enfants en charge. Elle est revendeuse et exerce comme activité la vente de charbon de bois à domicile. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et dans les coins reculés du pays. Son premier prêt qu’elle sollicite, lui servira à acheter des charbons de bois afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle voudrait augmenter son stock de marchandises et assurer les besoins primaires de la famille. Notons qu’elle est dans cette activité il y a 02ans.
texts.en: Adjowavi is 30 years old. Her husband is a forwarding agent and she is currently not responsible for any children. She is a retailer and sells charcoal door-to-door. She gets her supplies in Lomé and from remote corners of the country. She is requesting her first loan which will be used to buy charcoal so that she is better able to respond to her customers' needs. She would like to increase her inventory of merchandise and take care of her family's basic needs. She has been in her line of work for 2 years.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina de 43 años, convive con Abdon con quien tiene 1 hija, liseth de 19 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia ubicada en un anexo agrícola. Delfina es una madre esmerada y responsable. Se dedica a la agricultura desde los 19 años. Al lado de Abdon, ha conseguido muchas satisfacciones con esta actividad, “gracias  a la agricultura tengo mi casa y terrenos propios”, menciona. Ella se encarga de producir arvejas, maíz, papas, alfalfa y flores de gladiolos. Por la variedad de sus sembríos siempre está ocupada y siempre tiene ventas e ingresos para su familia y para ahorrar.
Estos meses son cruciales para las siembras de todo tipo, ya que las lluvias empezaron. Delfina no se quiere quedar atrás, por eso esta vez solicita de su apoyo para sembrar arvejas, habas y papas, cuyas cosechas estarán listas para febrero del año próximo. Éste es su crédito número 13 con MFP. Se compromete en pagar, una vez más, con puntualidad las cuotas. Ella es la tesorera de su banco comunal “Santa Cruz de Patay”, y se siente a gusto de tener socios participativos. Ella requiere 3900 soles para adquirir 5 bolsas de semillas de arvejas (2500 soles). Y con lo restante quiere comprar varias bolsas de abonos orgánicos y guano de granja para sus cultivos futuros de habas, papas y arvejas.
texts.en:
Delfina, 43, lives with Abdon and they have a 19-year-old daughter, Lisbeth.  They live in their own house on a farm.  Delfina is a loving, responsible mother who has been working in agriculture since she was 19.  Together with Abdon, she has gained much satisfaction from this activity, "Thanks to agriculture, I have my own house and land", she says.  She grows peas, maize, potatoes, alfalfa and gladiolous flowers.  Because of the variety of her crops she is always busy, and always has sales and income for the household and to save.

These months are crucial for all the crops because the rains have started.  Delfina does not want to get behind and therefore is requesting your help to plant peas, beans and potatoes, which will be ready for harvest in February next year.  This is her 13th loan through MFP.  She is committed to paying it back on time.  She is the treasurer of her communal bank "Santa Cruz de Patay", and is very comfortable having active members in her group.  

She is requesting 3,900 PEN to buy 5 sacks of pea seeds (2,500 PEN).  The rest will be used to buy several bags of organic fertilizer and farm manure for her future bean, potato and pea crops.

loans.use: To buy 5 bags of pea seeds and several bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Tujikaze Group

texts.fr: La cliente Moina est président du groupe Tujikaze, alors âgée de 48 ans, marié et mère de 5 enfants qui vont tous a l’école. Son conjoint est sans emploi. La cliente est commerçante de divers. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son grand frère. Plus tard, elle bénéficia un fonds additionnel de crédit de Hekima. Elle vient de réaliser 20 cycles dans ce programme de microcrédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 3 sacs de riz, 3 sacs de sucres, 10 casiers de Fanta, etc. Malgré le défi et autres pertes dans cette activité, la cliente reconnait avoir tiré profits dans ce programme de Hekima. Ainsi, elle salut l’initiative de l’IMF Hekima et ses partenaires.
texts.en:
Moina is the leader of the Tujikaze group. She is 48 years old, married and the mother of 5 children who all attend school. Her spouse is unemployed.

Moina sells various items. She started her business with her own funds, received from her big brother. Later on, she benefited from additional funds in the form of loans from Hekima. She has just completed 20 loan cycles of Hekima's microcredit program. This new loan will be used to buy merchandise including 3 bags of rice, 3 bags of sugar and 10 cases of Fanta.

In spite of the various challenges and other losses in her business, the client recognises that she has profited from the Hekima program. She therefore commends the initiative of IMF Hekima and its partners.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of rice, 3 bags of sugar, 10 cases of Fanta, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro de 49 años vive con Ceferina, su pareja y madre de sus hijos. Ahora solo vive con Alcides de 24 años. Ellos habitan una casa propia que construyeron con esfuerzo, ubicada en un anexo agrícola. Pedro es un hombre responsable y trabajador. Desde joven le gustó el trabajo de campo, por eso hasta ahora se dedica a las labores agrícolas. “Siembro papas, maíz, arvejas, habas, flores de gladiolos, y otros; crece de todo aquí”, menciona orgulloso. En sus más de 25 años de trabajo ha conseguido muchas satisfacciones y frustraciones, pero afirma que todas esas experiencias lo ayudan en su crecimiento como emprendedor. 
Dice que la siembra de todos sus productos son rentables, solo depende de cultivarlos en meses específicos para cosecharlos cuando los precios sean buenos.
Ahora cuenta con terrenos propios que poco a poco iba pagando, ya que antes tenía que arrendarlos.
En sus planes próximos están el cultivar arvejas y maíz, por eso solicita de su apoyo. Éste es su crédito número 13 con MPF. Como en los préstamos anteriores menciona que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Cruz de Patay”, y es un socio puntual y participativo.
Invertirá los 3000 soles solicitados en la compra de 4 bolsas de semillas de arvejas (2000 soles) y los 1000 restantes serán para adquirir abonos orgánicos.
texts.en:
Pedro, 49, lives in Ceferina with his common-law wife, the mother of his children.  A 24-year-old son, Alcides, is the only one living at home.  They live in their own house which they built through their hard work on farm land.  Pedro is a responsible, hard-working man who has enjoyed working on the farm since he was a young man.  "I grow potatoes, maize, peas, beans, gladiolous flowers and other crops; everything grows here", he says proudly.  In the 25 years he has been working he has obtained much satisfaction, along with frustration, but says all the experience helps him develop as an entrepreneur.

He claims that his crop business is profitable and only depends on harvest coinciding with specific months when prices are higher.

He now has his own land, which he has paid for little by little, since before he was renting.  His future plans are to grow peas and maize, so he is requesting your help.  This is his 13th loan through MPF.  He is committed to paying it back on time as with his previous loans.  He belongs to the communal bank "Santa Cruz de Patay" and is a punctual, active member of the group.

He will use 3,000 PEN to buy 4 bags of pea seeds (2,000 PEN) and the remaining 1,000 PEN to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy 4 bags of pea seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Tujenge Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kahambu est président du groupe Tujenge, alors âgée de 37 ans, marié et mère de 8 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Son conjoint est un maitre cuisinier. La cliente est commerçante de divers et sociétaire d’une petite boutique. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia un crédit fonds addition de crédit de Hekima. Elle vient de réaliser 19 cycles dans ce programme de microcrédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 2 sacs de riz, 1 sacs de sucres, 5 casiers de Fanta, 25 litres d’huile Rina, etc. Malgré le défi et autres perte dans cette activité, la cliente reconnait avoir gagné de profits dans ce programme de Hekima. Ainsi, elle salut l’initiative de l’IMF Hekima et ses partenaires. Il sied de signaler que deux clientes, leurs figures n'est visibles sur cette photo.
texts.en:
Kahambu is the leader of the Tujenge group. She is 37 years old, married and the mother of 8 children who all go to school. Her spouse is a master chef.

Kahambu sells various items and is a member of a small shop. She started her business with her own funds, received from her husband. Later on, she benefited from additional funds in the form of loans from Hekima. She has just completed 19 loan cycles of Hekima's microcredit program. This new loan will be used to buy merchandise including 2 bags of rice, 1 bag of sugar, 5 cases of Fanta and 25 litres of Rina oil.

In spite of the various challenges and other losses in this business, the client acknowledges that she has profited from the Hekima program. She therefore commends the initiative of IMF Hekima and its partners.

2 of the group members cannot be seen in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of rice, 1 bag of sugar, 5 cases of Fanta, 25 litres of Rina oil, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Tujengeni Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kalere est président du groupe Tujengeni, alors âgée de 52 ans, marié et mère de 7 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Son conjoint est un chroniqueur Journaliste auprès d’une  radio évangélique. La cliente est commerçante de divers et sociétaire d’un petit kiosque de vente. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia un crédit fonds addition de crédit de Hekima. Elle vient de réaliser 19 cycles dans ce programme de microcrédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir au renforcement de chiffre d’affaire en achetant 3 sacs de riz, 4 sacs de sucres, 10 casiers de Fanta, 50 litres d’huile Rina, etc. Malgré le défi et autres perte dans cette activité, la cliente reconnait avoir gagné de profits dans ce programme de Hekima. Ainsi, elle salut l’initiative de l’IMF Hekima et ses partenaires.
texts.en:
The client Kalere is the president of the Tujengeni group. She is 52 years old, married, and a mother of 7 children, all of whom go to school. Her husband is a column journalist with a evangelical radio station.

Kalere is a retailer of various goods and a part-owner of a small sales kiosk. She started her business with her own funds received from her husband. Later, she benefited from additional loans through Hekima. She recently reached her 19th loan cycle in Hekima's micro-lending program. 

This new loan is going to serve to increase her sales turnover by buying 3 sacs of rice, 4 sacs of sugar, 10 cases of Fanta, 50 liters of Rina oil, etc. 

Despite the challenges and other losses in this business, Kalere recognizes the profits earned with this Hekima program. Thus, she commends the initiative by Hekima and its partners.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacs of rice, 4 sacs of sugar, 10 cases of Fanta, and 50 liters of Rina oil

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Yulisa Del Carmen

texts.es: Yulisa del Carmen de 40 anos de edad, casada con tres hijos, todos bajo su responsabilidad ya que  están estudiando en la Universidad y secundaria respetivamente.  Para ella es una gran alegría y gozo que sus hijos salgan adelante y sean profesionales para que tenga mejores condiciones de vida, y no tenga tantas limitaciones como las tiene ella. Por falta de estudios que en su juventud no pudo realizar  por falta de recursos económicos no pudo realizar sus sueños de ser una mujer estudiada y tener un mejor  nivel académico. Yulisa del Carmen siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable. Ella tiene por actividad económica la venta de juguetes, leche, hielo actividades que las realiza en conjunto con su esposo. La rutina de Yulisa es levantarse en horas muy temprano para vender la leche y hielo en su casa de habitación .también el esposo de Yulisa sale a vender leche de forma ambulante. El negocio de juguete lo tienen ubicado en un parque de la localidad. En la actualidad tienen 11 anos trabajando en sus negocios el cual va creciendo poco a poco y ha sido un medio de vida rentable y sostenible para su familia. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de juguete previendo que viene la temporada navideña  y necesita ofrecer mejor servicios a sus clientes y aprovechar la temporada para mejorar sus ingresos  económicos. Yulisa agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a los pequeños comerciantes de escasos  recursos y países pobre económicamente como es Nicaragua para tener una fuente de trabajo digna.
texts.en:
Yulisa del Carmen, 40, is married and has three children who are all under her responsibility since they students at the university and high school, respectively.  It makes her happy to know her children can get ahead and become professionals with better living conditions, without the limitations she grew up with.  She was unable to get an education when she was young because of a lack of resources; so she could not realize her dream of being an educated woman with high academic skills.

Yulia del Carmen has always been a hard-working, responsible woman.  Her business is selling toys, milk, and ice, together with her husband.  Yulisa's routine consists of getting up early to sell milk and ice out of her house.  Her husband also sells milk as a street vendor.  Her toy business is located at one of the town's parks.  She has been in business for 11 years now and it is growing little by little into a profitable, sustainable lifestyle for the family.

She plans to use the loan as work capital and to buy toys for the upcoming Christmas season.  She wants to offer her customers better service and take advantage of the season to improve her income.  Yulisa is grateful to Kiva lenders for helping small business owners with scarce resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so they can have a decent source of income.

loans.use: To buy toys for the upcoming Christmas season.

loans.name: Dusabimana Group

texts.fr:
Virginie fait partie du groupe Dusabimana  et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 36 ans et est mariée à Nestor,  un commerçant  d’habits et de savons. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants dont 3 étudient.

Elle est  commerçante d’habits et de savons depuis   9 ans. 

Elle est à son  onzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  construire un magasin en  ville.
texts.en:
Virginie is a member of the Dusabimana group and lives in Gitega. She is 36 years old and is married to Nestor, a clothes and soap retailer. Together they have 5 children, 3 of whom go to school. Virginie has [also] been selling clothes and soap for 9 years.

Virginie is on her 11th loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy a lot of clothes to resell, in order to earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to build a shop in town.

loans.use: to buy many clothes to resell

loans.name: Mari

texts.es:
Mari de 36, convive con su pareja con quien tiene 2 hijos: Noe de 8, Britney de 5 años. Todos ello viven en una casa propia ubicada en un anexo agrícola. Mari es una mujer de principios y de actitud luchadora para el trabajo. Desde los 16 años trabaja como agricultora en terrenos que heredó de sus padres. En ellos produce arvejas, habas, papas, maíz, etc. 
“Me gusta trabajar en el campo, a mi esposo también, los 2 nos dividimos las tareas”, menciona. Además dice que, la venta de arvejas estos días es  buena porque el precio del saco subió de 90 a 120 soles. Con ese dinero podrá comprar más semillas de otros productos, ya que las lluvias empezaron y quiere aprovecharlas al máximo. Mari ya empezó con la siembra de papas, por eso también se esmerará en sus cuidados.
Su meta para este año se enfoca en adquirir más semillas y fertilizantes para sembrar arvejas y papas. Por eso requiere de se apoyo. Éste es su crédito número 10 con MFP. Se compromete en pagar las cuotas con puntualidad. Pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Cruz de Patay” y se siente a gusto como socia por tener compañeros con los mismos intereses. Con los 2500 soles del préstamo podrá comprar 4 bolsas de semillas de arvejas y varias bolsas de abono orgánico como guano de granja.
texts.en:
Mari, 36, lives with her common-law husband and their two children, Noe, 8, and Britney, 5.  They live in their own house on farmland.  Mari is a woman of principles who has a very strong work ethic.  She has worked as a farmer ever since she was 16 on farmland she inherited from her parents, and on which she grows peas, beans, potatoes, maize, etc.

"I enjoy working on the farm, and so does my husband, and we split the chores", she states.  She also says pea sales are going well these days because the price per sack has gone from 90 to 120 PEN.  With that money she plans to buy more seeds for other crops since the rains have begun and she wants to take full advantage of the moment.  Mari has begun planting potatoes which she will take good care of.

Her goal for this year is to buy more seeds and fertilizer to plant peas and potatoes.  Therefore she is requesting your support.  This is her tenth loan through MFP and she is committed to paying back the loan on time.  She belongs to the communal bank "Santa Cruz de Patay" and enjoys being a member because she shares similar interests with the other members of the group.  The 2,500 PEN loan will be used to buy 4 bags of pea seeds and several bags of organic fertilizder, such as farm manure.

loans.use: To buy 4 bags of pea seeds and several bags or organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Piedras Blancas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PIEDRAS BLANCAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María Eugenia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de busos, panadería, venta de ropa usada, venta de juguetes y dulces, costura de deportivos, venta de verduras, venta de muebles y jugo de naranja, venta de juguetes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María Eugenia es integrante, ella indica que hace veinte años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa.  En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de dulces y juguetes, aprendiendo este emprendimiento de su familia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de dulces y juguetes) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación de crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The “PIEDRAS BLANCAS” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Germán Busch Center. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors of which María Eugenia  is the president. The members' businesses are varied. Among them we have: selling sweaters, a bread bakery, selling used clothing, selling toys and candies, sewing sports clothing, selling vegetables, selling furniture and orange juice, and selling toys. 

The loan they are taking out will benefit the small businesswomen. María Eugenia is one of them. She says that twenty years ago she joined Pro Mujer on the invitaion of a counselor from the institution who visited her home. Right now she has a business selling candies and toys. She learned about this enterprise from her family. 
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital by buying candies and toys. She will acquire them from distributors and later sell them in her locale. This will let her generate income to support her family as much as possible, because she in single and has seven children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the trainings about credit and health.

loans.use: to buy candies and toys.

loans.name: Sonrisa Group

texts.es:
Sonrisa es un grupo integrado por 8 personas: Nisha venta de comida, Estela venta de comida, Lorena venta de ropa, Jesika venta de refrescos, Minerva rotulos, Grissel venta de abarrotes, Heladio venta de tacos, Guadalupe venta de calzado. Ellos decidieron llamar asi a su grupo ya que son muy alegres y sonrientes, esta ubicado en la comunidad de Acatlan de Perez Figueroa la cual se encuentra en una region cañera. 

Doña Minerva solo estudio la secundaria, esta casada con el señor Jaime, ellos tienen un hijo y desde hace mas de 15 años tienen una imprenta en el centro de su comunidad en la cual brindan el servicio de elaboracion rotulos en camisa, vasos, bolsas, lonas, uniformes, volantes e invitaciones. Ella dice  con el paso de estos años han ganado buenos clientes gracias a el buen trabajo que se realiza en su imprenta ya que eso es lo que ayuda a que sus clientes vuelvan y los recomienden. Ella est muy contenta porque su negocio es familiar y espera que en un futuro sus hijos tambien aprendar a realizar este tipo de trabajos. Un credito de VisionFund dara a doña Minerva la oportunidad de comprar tintas, vasos, playeras, papel, bolsas y dar mantenimiento a su equipo para continuar realizando su actividad.

Doña Minerva desea que su negocio continue prosperando  y poder brindar a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.

El grupo sonrisa agradece el apoyo que se les esta dando atravez de estos prestamos.
texts.en:
Sonrisa (Smile) is a group comprised of eight members: Nisha, who sells food, Estela sells food, Lorena sells clothing, Jesika sells soft drinks, Minerva has a printing business, Grissel sells groceries, Heladio sells tacos and Guadalupe sells shoes.  They decided to give their group this name because they are very cheerful and smiling.  The group is located in the community of Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, which is in the cane region.

Minerva only has a middle school education and is married to Jaime.  They have a son, and for over 15 years have been running a printing business in the center of town where they print signage on t-shirts, mugs, bags, canvas, uniforms, flyers and invitations.  She says that over the years they have acquired good customers thanks to their good work.  So their customers always return and even recommend their services.  She is happy because hers is a family business and in the future she hopes her son will also learn the trade.  A loan from VisionFund will give Minerva the opportunity to buy inks, mugs, t-shirts, paper and bags; and to pay for equipment maintenance, since it is always in use.

Minerva wants to continue prospering in her business in order to give her son a better quality of life.

The Sonrisa Group is grateful for the support received by way of these loans.

loans.use: To buy ink, mugs, t-shirts, paper and bags; and to pay for equipment maintenance.

loans.name: Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
Guadalupe tiene 28 años. Ella se quedó en la escuela hasta la secundaria. Está casada y tiene tres hijos. Dos de ellos van a la escuela primaria. Guadalupe es otro de los miembros del grupo Estrellitas.

Hace tres años, Guadalupe comenzó a vender refrescos en su casa a sus amigos y vecinos. Ella trabaja para apoyar a su esposo ya su familia con este ingreso adicional. Ella necesita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de variedad de refrescos.

Guadalupe espera que este crédito le ayudará a que su negocio prospere porque ella desea que sus hijos siguen asistiendo a la escuela y para seguir apoyando a su marido. Ella será capaz de proporcionar una vida mejor a su familia.

Los demas integrantes del grupo son: Ines vanta de carne, Zacarías venta de abarrotes, Deysi venta de ropa, Rosa María venta de tacos, Gregoria venta de calzado, María Rosa venta de tortillas y Teodora venta de antojitos.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 28 years old and stayed in school up to high school level.  She is married and has three children.  Two of her children attend elementary school.  Guadalupe is a member of the Estrellitas group.

Three years ago, Guadalupe started selling soft drinks from her home to her friends and neighbors.  She works to support her husband and her family with this additional income.  She needs a loan to invest in buying a variety of soft drinks.

Guadalupe hopes that this loan will help her business to thrive because she would like her children to continue attending school and would like to continue supporting her husband.  She will be able to provide her family with a better life.

The other members of this group are: Ines, who sells meat; Zacarías, who sells groceries; Deysi, who sells clothing; Rosa María, who sells tacos; Gregoria, who sells footwear; María Rosa, who sells tortillas, and Teodora who sells snacks.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan y su esposa Rosario son productores de café desde hace muchos años. Ellos tienen 2 hijas y entre toda la familia se dedican a esta actividad. Juan es socio de la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” y es allí en donde entrega toda su producción para que sea procesada y exportada. Durante la cosecha pasada la producción de Juan no fue muy buena debido a las condiciones climatológicas sin embargo confía en que este año le irá mucho mejor. Para la cosecha Juan contrata jornaleros que le ayuden a cortar el café y necesita un crédito para poder pagar sus servicios. Este crédito lo pagará al final de la cosecha. Dentro de 2 años Juan considera que podrá aumentar considerablemente su producción pues acaba de sembrar nuevas plantas hace poco. Entre las metas que tiene Juan aparte del café está la de sembrar caña en un terreno que tiene desocupado.
texts.en: Juan and his wife Rosario have been coffee growers for many years. They have 2 daughters and the whole family works in this activity. Juan  is a member of the “Regional Union of Huatusco”. That is where he delivers all of his product so it can be processed and exported. During the last harvest Juan's crop wasn't very good due to weather conditions. Nonetheless, he is confident this year it will go much better for him. For the harvest Juan hires laborers who help him pick the coffee and he needs a loan to pay for their services.Juan thinks that within two years he will be able to increase his production considerably because he just planted new plants a short time ago. Among Juan's goals apart from the coffee are planting sugar cane on some land he isn't using.

loans.use: to pay workers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy several items for her shop; beans, rice, peas, etc.

loans.name: Las Rayadas Group

texts.es: Las rayadas son un grupo solidario conformado por 5 mujeres muy trabajadoras, y llamado así porque la mayoría de sus integrantes le van al equipo de futbol rayados. Erika un una mujer joven de 27 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos de 6, 5 y 2 años de edad. Su esposo es chofer y ella es estilista. Comenzó trabajando primero en una estética de una vecina y como le gustaba ese trabajo, se puso a juntar dinero para empezar a comprar cosas para hacerse de su propia estética. El crédito la ha ayudado a comprar sillones, sillas y productos como tintes, peróxidos,mascarillas, etc. Erika quiere tener su propia casa y su negocio bien establecido, ya que aun vive en casa de sus papas y para ella es u poco incomodo. El grupo de las rayadas casi nunca ha tenido problemas y cuando los tuvo salieron adelante apoyándose.
texts.en: The Rayadas [the Striped Ones] are a support group made up of 5 hardworking women. It is called that because most of the members go the soccer game wearing stripes. Erika is a 27 year old young woman who is in a common law marriage and has 3 children aged 6, 5 and 2. Her husband is a driver and she is a stylist. She starting working first in a neighbor's salon and since she liked the work, she saved up some money to start buying things to open her own salon. The loan has helped her to buy salon chairs, chairs and products such as dyes, peroxide, masks, etc. Erika wants to own her own home and have a well established business, since she still lives in her parents' home and it's a little uncomfortable. The Rayadas group has almost never had problems and when they did have them they kept going ahead and supporting each other.

loans.use: to buy chairs, salon chairs, peroxide, dyes, etc.

loans.name: Mama Inuka Group

texts.fr: La cliente Françoise est entrepreneur dynamique ambitieux, alors vice présidente du groupe Mama Inuka, âgée d’environ 43 ans, divorcée, mère de 6 enfants.  Elle vend l’huile de palme. Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son ex mari avant qu’ils divorcent. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de fonds additionnel de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima pour renforcer son capital.  Il ya 3 ans, elle est en activité. Elle installe ses produits  au long de la rue dans le quartier Ndosho. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  les 2 fus d’huile de palme, 2 sacs de riz, 1 sac de haricot,etc. En plus, elle ambitionne augmenter son compte épargne, scolariser, nourrir et vêtir confortablement ses enfants. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues non bancables.
texts.en: Françoise is a dynamic and ambitious entrepreneur, and vice-president of the Mama Inuka group. She is around 43 years old, divorced and the mother of 6 children. She sells palm oil. She started her business with her own funds, which she received from her ex-husband before they got divorced. Later on, she benefited from additional funds in the form of loans from IMF Hekima to reinforce her capital. She has been in business for 3 years. She displays her products on the side of a road in the Ndosho district. This new loan should be used to buy supplies including 2 cans of palm oil, 2 bags of rice and 1 bag of beans. Her aim is to build up her savings account and make sure her children are properly clothed, fed and educated. The customer would like to thank Hekima for its actions in aid of impoverished women excluded from regular bank lending channels.

loans.use: to buy 2 cans of palm oil, 2 bags of rice, 1 bag of beans, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Nawal prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her son. Nawal is a 59-year-old married woman from Al Nasser Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for home improvements.  She would like to do maintenance of the home before the winter season and to repaint the rooms. She hopes in the future to expand her home and to buy a car.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Revendeuse des produits d’alimentation générale dans une boutique, madame afi est âgée de 41ans. C’est en 2004 qu’elle démarré cette activité et elle s’y plait bien car cela lui procure des revenus lui permettant de se prendre en charge. Elle sollicite de WAGES un second crédit. Avec ce montant, elle va s’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle veut augmenter son stock et s’épanouir.
texts.en: Afi is 41 years old and sells groceries in a shop. She started this business in 2004 and likes it a lot as it provides an income which enables her to be self-sufficient. She is requesting a second loan from WAGES and will use the money to buy grocery products. Her future expectations include increasing her inventory and fulfilling her potential.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 41 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 18 years. He will use Kiva loan to support labor costs and  to buy fertilizer. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his maize production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Izzat

texts.en: Izzat is a 52-year-old married man and father of five children. His grocery store and espresso businesses are going on just fine, and have provided his family with a better living. Izzat is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a power generator necessary for his business to keep almost all of his beverages cold and fresh as much as he can. He will also use part of the loan to register his car. This is his third cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower and the second as Kiva's. He is very proud that he had this experience, and hopes to stay up on customer's needs and requests.

loans.use: to buy a power generator necessary for his business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is applying for his second loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Peter will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will increase his income and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 39-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are attending school. For the past year, she has been operating her own business, selling cereals from her home. Previously, Mary was selling charcoal. Her aim is to open a retail shop to sell a variety of household items including the cereals she is currently selling. Mary is a dedicated woman who loves her job and one who has the vision of progressing in life. She has requested a loan to increase her inventory so as to meet the demand of her customers. With this loan, she plans to buy sacks of dried maize for sale.

loans.use: to buy sacks of dried maize for sale.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
This is Analyn, 30, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Joel, a driver, and a mother to her child. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Analyn operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, and dahlias, and also varieties of hanging plants and others alike. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the nearby community.  She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and garden inputs for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Analyn dreams of growing her business in the coming years and hopes to live a peaceful life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and garden inputs needed in her business.

loans.name: Soad

texts.en: Soad is a 44-year-old married woman who has two family members from AL Khaledieh, Al Mafraq, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy new furniture. She hopes to expand her home in the future and to buy more furniture for her living room. Also, she hopes to buy a new home and to start a project for her family to increase her family income.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is 47 years old, married and has five children. He is the only provider for the family.

Ali owns a small restaurant. He established his business in 2010 after long experience in this field. He has now two employees and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $1800 loan to renovate the restaurant. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the restaurant.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a 30-year-old married woman who has four family members from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to buy blankets to resell in the same area; she wants to develop her project by increasing her product range. In the future she hopes to open a shop to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy blankets to resell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda, She previously accessed a 21,000 PHP loan that she used buy more fruit and vegetables. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to purchase more fruit and vegetables needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Yolanda dreams of being able to give her all her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work on her business. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God. 


* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. Fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more fruit and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena  sells groceries, She is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer. Some of the  groceries she sells are soap, toothbrushes, toothpaste and others. Her business is 6 years old.  She uses her income to help her partner to take care of the home. 

Abena will use the loan to purchase other types of groceries like canned  fish, canned tomatoes, Milo (breakfast drink powder), different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees,  milk, soap, etc. to sell. She plans to  build a shop.
