She is a hardworking and determined person and in this way the member gets her family ahead. She is asking for the credit to purchase merchandise such as jackets for children. She feels appreciative for the credit given and promises to comply with the established quotas.

loans.use: to purchase clothes like children's jackets

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 42 years old and is married to Reynaldo. The couple have two children.  Reynaldo works providing motorcycle transport and the couple works ceaselessly to earn income to provide for their family's needs. Magdalena also works selling vegetables. 

Magdalena is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy tires, gasoline, and crude oil for Reynaldo to use to expand his transport business. She hopes that her loan will ensure safe travel for their passengers and for her spouse as well. In the future, Magdalena would like to start raising pigs and continue to grow as a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy tires, gasoline, and crude oil for her husband's transportation business

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo is 34 years old. She is widowed and resides with her two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables and growing mushrooms for more than three years, earning approximately $5 daily. 

In order to stabilize her family’s living condition, Keo is requesting a loan of $1300 to purchase more vegetables to sell. By doing so, she would earn more income to financially support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda de 37 años convive con Juan Martín, con quien tiene 2 hijos: Cristian de 12 y Johnny de 6 años. Todos ellos viven en una casa propia que construyeron con esfuerzo y se ubica en un anexo agrícola. Nilda es una mujer de carácter bondadoso pero muy persistente. Se dedica a la agricultura desde los 20 años, el tiempo que lleva conviviendo con su pareja. Desde entonces trabaja la tierra produciendo: arvejas, habas, cebada, flores de gladiolos y maíz.  “Me conviene sembrar arvejas, habas y flores de gladiolos, porque en 4 meses ya estoy cosechando”, menciona.
Gracias a su constancia en sus labores ha logrado adquirir animales como toros, con los que ara la tierra. Además consiguió comprar un terreno y así se ahorra en el pago de arriendo.
Sus metas se centran en aumentar su producción y sus ventas, por ello está vez quiere sembrar en otras parcelas arrendadas. Ella solicita otro crédito para adquirir abonos orgánicos, porque ya cuenta con las semillas. Éste es su préstamo número 13 con MFP. Da su palabra de pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales como en ocasiones anteriores. Pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Cruz de Patay”, y le agrada el trabajo en equipo. Con el dinero podrá adquirir 5 bolsas de abonos orgánicos y varias bolsas de guano de granja.
texts.en:
Nilda, 37, lives with Juan Martín with whom she has two children: Cristian, 12, and Johnny, 6. They all live together in the house they built with effort located in an agricultural annex.  Nilda is a woman with a kind but very persistent disposition.  She’s been working in agriculture for 20 years, the time she and her spouse have been together.  Since then she’s worked the land producing peas, lima beans, barley, gladiola flowers and corn.  “It’s advantageous for me to plant peas, lima beans and gladiola flowers because in just four months I can be harvesting them,” she mentions.  Thanks to her constancy at work she’s managed to acquire animals like bulls she uses to till the land.  She also managed to buy a piece of land so she now saves the leasing fees.

Her goals are centered on increasing production and sales which is why this time she wants to plant on other leased parcels.  She’s requesting another loan to buy organic manure because she already has the seeds.  This is her 13th MFP loan.  She gives her word that she’ll make her monthly installment payments punctually like she’s done before.  She’s a member of the “Santa Cruz de Patay” communal bank and she enjoys the teamwork.  With the money she will be able to buy five sacks of organic manure and several sacks of barnyard guano.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of organic manure and several sacks of fowl guano.

loans.name: Idalia

texts.es: Idalia de cuarenta años es casada, vive en una casa de interés social con su esposo y trabaja en una tintorería de la localidad lavando ropa y por las tardes trabaja con la dueña de la tintorería como empleada domestica su esposo trabaja como cocinero en un restaurant  y desde hace diez años compraron una casa con ahorros propios y con mucho esfuerzo, poco a poco le han ido haciendo mejoras; cuando ellos iniciaron la construcción de su casa no pensaron que el tener las escaleras en la parte de afuera a futuro les podía ser incomodo y que tendrían que quitarlas para construirlas por dentro. Ellos tienen la necesidad de de construir dentro de su casa ya que el tenerla afuera hoy en día implica inseguridad para su hogar y solicita el apoyo para poder realizar su proyecto.
texts.en: Idalia, 40, is married, lives in publicly subsidized housing with her husband, and works at a dry cleaner of the town washing clothes. In the afternoons she works with the dry cleaner's owner as a domestic employee. Her husband works as a cook in a restaurant and ten years ago they bought a house with their own savings and a lot of effort. Little by little they have been making improvements to it. When they began the construction of their home they did not think having outdoor stairs would be uncomfortable for them in the future and that they would have to remove them in order to construct them inside. They have the need to build them inside the house since having them outside these days entails a lack of security for the home, and she is requesting the support to be able to carry out her project.

loans.use: to build stairs inside her house

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes used her previous loan to buy maize to sell. She is a 34-year-old single mother of two children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her dream is to build rental houses so she can earn income out of them. 

Agnes has been selling produce for the last three years. She started with capital of 200,000, and now the business is worth 1,500,000. In spite of this, Agnes has been challenged by the high cost of rent and the rainy season, which makes transportation of produce from the village difficult. She is requesting another loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Progresistas Group

texts.es:
Progresistas son un grupo solidario de 6 mujeres, las integrantes de la mesa directiva decidieron llamarlo así porque les gusto, además de que significa avanzar hacia adelante.

Ángela es una de las integrantes del grupo, tiene 35 años, es casada y vive en el municipio de García junto a sus 3 hijos de 9, 7 y 4 años, todos son estudiantes. Su esposo tiene empleo fijo y además trabaja por su propia cuenta arreglando televisiones y realizando instalaciones eléctricas. Ángela se dedica a la venta de suplementos alimenticios como pastillas, jarabes, malteadas, endulzantes; menciona que necesita surtir mas producto ya que ha tenido mucha demanda. Ella desea seguir con la venta de dichos productos, ya que algunos de ellos le dejan hasta un 50% de ganancia.
texts.en:
“Progresistas” is a group of six women.  The members of the board chose this name because they liked it and it symbolizes moving forward.
Ángela is one of the members. She’s 35 years old, married, and lives in the town of García, along with her three children, ages 9, 7, and 4.  All attend school.
Her husband has a steady job and also works on his own repairing televisions and doing electrical installation work.  Ángela sells dietary supplements, such as pills, syrups, malts, and sweeteners.  She says that she wants to increase her inventory because she has had lots of demand.  She wants to continue selling said products, since some of them generate up to 50% profit.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: El Cedro Group

texts.es:
Doña Rosalia es otro de los integrantes del grupo El Cedro ella tiene la edad 38 años, estudio solo la secundaria, y es madre soltera de un hijo, ella platica que hace 7 años decidió abrir su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes ya que quería trabajar desde casa para darle mas atención a su hijo, ella inicio vendiendo en un espacio en una habitación de su hogar y actualmente ya construyo un local en su patio en el cual ha puesto su negocio,  ella dice que se vende muy bien ya que su negocio es uno de los mas surtidos en su comunidad, ella esta contenta con su negocio porque que algunas veces su hijo lo ayuda a despachar y esta aprendiendo a trabajar.   Doña Rosalia invertirá este crédito  en la compra de arroz, frijol, azúcar, sal, aceite, dulces, refrescos, productos enlatados, arina, papel higiénico, pasta dental.

Ella quiere que con esta inversión su negocio continué progresando y siga en el gusto de la gente, también le gustaría poder ofrecer a su hijo la  oportunidad de asistir a la universidad.

Las actividades de las demás integrantes son:

Cenorina Venta de pollo 
Camerina venta de ropa interior
Eloina venta de ropa 
Martha venta de comida 
Eustolia venta de zapatos 
Lindsay club de nutricion
Hipolita venta de abarrotes 
Irma venta de antojitos
texts.en:
Rosalia is another member of the “El Cerdo” group.  She’s 38 years old and only has a junior high school education.  She is the single mother of one son and she says that she opened her own grocery store business seven years ago, because she wanted to pay more attention to her son.  She began selling from a space in her home and has set up an area in her patio.  She says that sales are good because her business is one of the best stocked in the neighborhood.  She is happy because sometimes he son helps her serve customers and he is learning to work.  Rosalia will invest the money from this loan in rice, beans, sugar, salt, cooking oil, candy, soft drinks, canned goods, flour, bathroom tissue, and toothpaste.

She wants this loan to help her move forward and meet her customers’ needs.  She also wants to provide her son the opportunity to attend university.

The other members:
 
Cenorina sells poultry
Camerina sells undergarments
Eloina sells clothing
Martha sells food
Eustolia sells shoes
Lindsay runs a nutrition club
Hipolita sells groceries
Irma sells snacks

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La señora Irene tiene ya mas de tres años con su negocio de elaboración y ventas de piñatas (figuras arte cenales mexicanas).
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en comprar de material para la elaboración ya que tiene varios pedido pendientes para entregar y por falta del material no ha podido  terminar las piñatas y podre entregar a sus clientes el pedido a tiempo. 
La señora Irene es madre soltera tiene bajo su responsabilidad un hijo de tres años a quien le quiere dar lo mejor.
Con las ganancias que obtiene del negocio pagara el crédito y que con la pensión que recibe será para los gastos familiares y escolares de su hijo.
texts.en: Irene has already spent more than three years in the business of creating and selling piñatas (handcrafted Mexican figures). She is requesting a loan to be able to invest in the purchase of material for their creation, since she already has several pending orders to be delivered and for a lack of material she has not been able to finish the piñatas and she will be able to deliver her clients their orders on time. Irene is a single mother who has a three-year-old son under her care whom she wants to give the best to. With the earnings she obtains from the business she will pay back the loan and the payments she receives will be for family expenses and school expenses for her son.

loans.use: to buy material for the making of piñatas

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El socio tiene 36 años de edad y es soltero, el socio se dedica al negocio de venta de repuestos de carros, él socio vende parabrisas, llantas y pernos, el socio tiene una tienda donde atiende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, el socio ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de repuestos decarros.El socio solicita el credito para comprar repuestos como perabrisas,llantas y pernos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Daniel is 36 and single. He sells auto parts such as windshields, tires, and bolts. His shop is open from 9:00 a.m until 8:00 p.m. 

Daniel has 7 years of business experience and is prospering. His dream is to expand his replacement parts business and will use the loan to buy auto parts like windshields, tires, and bolts. Daniel is pleased with the loan and promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy auto parts like windshields, tires, and bolts.

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.es: Anatolia, de 37 años, vive en su propia casa junto  a su esposo Sergio de de 43 años, quien le apoya con los gastos de sus  03 adorados hijos. Anatolia, es una mujer muy perseverante y se dedica con mucho empeño al cultivo de café junto a su esposo; ambos saben el deber de  luchar por tener la mejor producción puesto que sus vecinos de su localidad también producen café. Anatolia lleva 24 años realizando esta actividad y comenta que para ella es muy embarazoso tener que combatir con las plagas que abaten sus plantaciones. Es por ello que acude a las oficinas de MFP para que le ayuden con los planes de trabajo que se propone a realizar para no dañen sus siembras. Ella espera el apoyo de los financistas para que pueda lograr con sus planes de trabajo y con el tiempo llegar a obtener la mejor cosecha de toda su localidad. Este es su crédito número 03, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus compromisos de pago, además esta conforme por la responsabilidad y puntualidad que ejercen cada de uno de sus socios, de su banco comunal. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará abono que le servirá para darle un mejoramiento continuo de sus plantaciones de café, con la finalidad de prevenir cualquier evento que pueda repercutir en sus plantaciones agrícolas.
texts.en: Anatolia is 37 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband Sergio, 43, who helps her paying for their expenses, and with their 3 beloved children. Anatolia is a very persevering woman who engages in growing coffee with great dedication together with her husband. They both know they have to work hard to obtain the best production, as coffee is produced also by other people in their area. Anatolia has been engaging in this activity for 24 years, and she says that it is very inconvenient for her to continuously fight the blights affecting her plantations. She has therefore come to MFP for as for their help in putting into practice the working plans she has to stop blights from damaging her crops. Anatolia wishes that the lenders will help her achieving her working plans in order to succeed in getting the best harvest of all her community in the future. This is her 3rd loan, and she guarantees she will faithfully comply with her repayments schedule; she also share the same responsibility and punctuality characterizing every single member of her Communal Bank. The 1,000 PEN she is requesting she will buy the manure she needs to provide a constant improvement to her coffee plantations, aiming at preventing any event that can affect her plantations.

loans.use: To buy manure for her crops.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria, de 45 años, es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora.  Es conviviente con Julio quien se dedica a la ganadería. Ella vive en casa de su pareja, a lado de su hija. Todos los días Victoria se dirige a su refrigerador en donde están los productos que ofrece a sus clientes, realiza su inventario y hace la lista de las bebidas que le hacen falta y se dirige al mercado a comprarlos. Cuando está en su casa, ordena, almacena y exhibe las bebidas de diversas marcas, presentaciones, sabores y tamaños. También tiene otros negocios como la ganadería pero en menor volumen.
Lleva realizando éste trabajo por 5 años y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de una ayudante.
Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja y la constante demanda.
Durante el tiempo que lleva realizando éste negocio se dio cuenta que nunca sabes que tipo o marca de bebida te van a pedir los clientes, ella es muy responsable con su negocio y con la sociedad es así que las bebidas gaseosas los vende a todo público pero las bebidas alcohólicas solo a mayores de edad según lo permitido en su cuidad.  Espera seguir manteniendo su negocio. Este es el crédito número 08 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración par continuar con sus objetivos.  Por otro lado, ella se compromete a seguir siendo puntual y cumplida como en los créditos anteriores que tuvo.  Además desea seguir trabajando con los socios de su banco comunal ya que todos son muy amables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará bebidas gasificadas de diversas marcas y presentaciones, para tener en stock disponible para la venta, ya que por el incremento de la temperatura en la zona cada día aumentan las ventas.
texts.en:
Victoria, 45, is an enterprising and determined woman.  She lives with Julio, who makes a living in livestock and with whom she has three children.  She lives in her partner's house together with her daughter.

She works a lot so she can give her family a better quality of life.  Every day Victoria goes to her refrigerator where she keeps the products she sells to her customers.  She does her inventory and makes a list of the beverages she needs, then goes to the market to buy them.  When she gets home she organizes, stores, and exhibits the beverages of different brands, containers, flavors, and sizes.  She also has other businesses but to a lesser extent, such as livestock.  She has been doing this work for five years and up to now she has had a helper.  She considers her business very profitable for the good earnings it gives her and for the constant demand.

In the time she has had this business, she has realized that you never know what type or brand of beverage customers are going to request.  She's very responsible with her business and with society.  That's why she sells carbonated drinks to everyone but alcoholic beverages only to adults of age, according to what's allowed in her city.  She hopes to continue supporting her business.

This is her eighth loan with MFP and she hopes for help to continue with her objectives.  On the other hand, she pledges to continue being punctual as with her previous loans.  She also wants to continue working with the members of her communal bank because they're all very nice and supportive.

With the requested loan of 3000 soles [PEN], she's going to buy carbonated beverages in a variety of brands and sizes to have disposable stock to sell because sales are going up with the higher temperatures in the area.

loans.use: to buy carbonated beverages

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Sokha is 23 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling food and rice for more than a year, earning approximately $10 daily. Her husband sells grilled eggs. He earns about $10 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sokha is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase materials to use in her food stall. This money will help her provide better service for the clients. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelors degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase materials to use in her food stall

loans.name: Evangelina Lucrecia

texts.es: Evangelina Lucrecia de  53 anos de edad, casada con tres hijos todos mayores de edad e independiente. Evangelina es del departamento de Chinandega lugar ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Lugar que se caracteriza por ser una zona comercial muy prospera. Evangelina siempre ha sido una mujer muy luchadora desde muy joven, trabajadora, disciplinada, perseverante con ganas de superación personal. Evangelina tiene por actividad económica el servicio de taxi, pulpería y venta en general. En los cuales tiene 30 anos de experiencia en dicho negocio. Antes de tener estos negocio tenia un tramo de venta de ropa en el mercado de la localidad el cual decidió vender porque las ventas no estaban dando ganancia y decidió comprar un taxi para trabajarlos. En la actualidad con la ganancias ha podido comprar otra unidad de taxi, invertir en una pulpería y en mercadería en general como ropa, calzado, cosmético lo cual distribuye de forma ambulante. También sus hijos participan de sus negocios. En este momento su prioridad es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar mercadería como: pantalones, camisas, vestidos, short, ropa interior, calzado, cosméticos. porque su demanda ha incrementado y de dicha forma poder sastifacer a su clientela. Evangelina ya ha trabajado con fundación y ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos en tiempo y forma. Ella agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a los pequeños comerciantes de países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo digno. En un país con tantas carencias económicas.
texts.en:
Evangelina Lucrecia, 53, is married and has three children who are all independent adults now.  She’s from Chinandega Department, a place located in the western part of the country.  It’s noted for being a very prosperous commercial zone.

Evangelina has always been a very determined woman, ever since she was young; hardworking, disciplined and perseverant with a strong drive for personal improvement.  Her economic activities are taxi service, a grocery store and sales in general.  She has 30 years’ experience in said business.  Before having these businesses she had a space in the local market where she sold clothes but she sold it because she wasn’t making much profit and she decided to buy a taxi to put to work.  Currently, with profits earned she’s been able to buy another taxi, invest in a grocery store and in general merchandise, like clothes, shoes and cosmetics, to sell from place to place.  Her children also participate in her businesses.  

At the moment, her priority is to invest in working capital and buy merchandise like pants, shirts, dresses, shorts, underwear, footwear and cosmetics because demand has increased and she will be able to satisfy her customers this way.  

Evangelina has worked with the Fundación in the past and has been responsible with her payments making them on time and as required.  She is grateful for support Kiva lenders provide small merchants in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a way to earn a livelihood with dignity especially in a country with so many economic needs.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba is a widow with 2 daughters. She lives and runs her business in Agsu region. Mahbuba rents a facility that serves as a grocery store. She sells food items, as well as household chemicals and other small items. Mahbuba decided to try her luck as a private entrepreneur eight years ago when her husband died. Currently, her net monthly profit is 350 AZN. 

Mahbuba requested a loan of 2000 AZN to purchase a batch of goods wholesale, i.e. tea, coffee, sugar, etc. This is her third loan from AqroInvest. One of her long-term plans is to purchase the facility she is renting at the moment and own it.

loans.use: to purchase a batch of goods wholesale

loans.name: Ahliman

texts.en:
Over the last several years Ahliman, a married father of three sons and two daughters, has purchased about 100 sheep to raise and sell. Now requesting his third loan from AqroInvest in the amount of 2000 AZN, he wishes to buy more sheep to increase the income he gets from selling them.

Ahliman's future plan is to establish a big farm with a variety of livestock and to move from raising and selling sheep to breeding them and selling sheep products.

loans.use: to buy more sheep.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is 53 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Helena is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Helena has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from dressmaking.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sonia Del Socorro

texts.es: Sonia del Socorro de 61 anos madre soltera con 6 hijos todos mayores de edad e independiente. Sonia es del municipio de Corinto, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona norte del país. Corinto se caracteriza por ser una pesquera, con sus puertos, donde su mayor actividad económica es la pesca. Sonia tiene por actividades económicas la venta de nacatamales, tamales comidas típicas muy sabrosas  de nuestro país elaborado a base de la carne del cerdo y maíz. Ella tiene 35 anos de experiencia en el negocio, siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable. En la actualidad su carga familiar es menos pesada porque sus hijos ya trabajan. Pero cuando era mas joven tuvo que luchar duro como madre soltera para sacar a sus hijos adelante. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante. Sonia del Socorro ya ha tenido crédito con fundación y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma, los cuales le han ayudado para sobrevivir en su negocio invirtiendo en capital de trabajo. Con el financiamiento pretendo invertir en la compra de cerdos  y quintales de maíz para elaborar sus productos. Sonia agradece la ayuda de los inversionista kiva le brindan a los pequeños comerciantes de escasos recursos, y países pobre como es Nicaragua, para tener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Sonia del Socorro, 61, is a single mother of six children, all independent adults now.  Sonia is from the town of Corinto, a place located in the northern part of the country.  Corinto is noted for being a fishing zone with ports; its main economic activity is fishing.

Sonia’s economic activities are selling nacatamales: very delicious, traditional tamales from Nicaragua made from pork and corn.  She has 35 years’ experience in the business; she’s always been noted for being very hardworking and responsible.  Her family obligation is a bit lighter now because her children all work but when she was younger she had to struggle mightily as a single mother to raise her children.

Her business is located at home and she sells from place to place too.  Sonia del Socorro has had previous loans with the Fundación and has been responsible making her payments on time and as required.  They have helped her to stay in business investing in working capital.  She intends to use the financing to buy pigs and quintals of corn to make her nacatamales.  Sonia is grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide small merchants of limited resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have dignified ways to earn a living.

loans.use: to buy live pigs and a quintal of corn to make nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales].

loans.name: Marta De La Cruz

texts.es: Marta de la cruz de  51 anos de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos de 27,24 anos independiente económicamente, Marta es originaria del municipio de corinto, lugar que se caracteriza por ser una zona de Puerto, un lugar muy tranquilo acogedor, con sus playas. Tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación el cual cuenta con una experiencia de 30 anos. Una pulpería es una tienda que vende productos al por menor como bolsitas de café, caja de fosforo, cigarros menudeados, granos básicos, detergentes, pasta dental, refresco naturales. La rutina diaria de Marta es de 15 horas diario desde las 6: am que abre sus puertas en su pulpería hasta las 9: de la noche. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería para brindar mejor servicios a sus clientes. Marta cruz ya ha trabajado con fundación el cual ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos en tiempo y forma. Marta de la cruz agradece la ayuda de los inversionistas kiva a las personas de escasos recursos para  tener fuentes de trabajo digno en países pobre económicamente como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Marta de la Cruz, 51, is a single mother of two children who are 27 and 24 years of age; they are economically independent.  Marta is from the municipality of Corinto, a place noted for its port; it’s a tranquil, welcoming place with beaches.  Her economic activity is a ‘pulpería’ [grocery store] located at home; she has 30 years’ experience in it.  A pulpería is a store that sells products like little bags of coffee, boxes of matches, individual cigarettes, basic grains, detergent, toothpaste and natural soft-drinks at retail.

Marta de la Cruz has worked with the Fundación in the past and has been responsible with her payments making them on time and as required.  She is grateful for the support Kiva lenders give to people of scarce resources so that they can have sources of dignified employment in economically poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: Humberto tiene 23 años, es de cliza, soltero y no tiene hijos, hace 4 años que vive separado de sus padres, por motivos de estudios salió a la ciudad a estudiar técnico en celulares para poder reparar, actualmente continua sus estudios en la universidad, esta estudiando Ingeniería de sistemas va en el segundo semestre, para poder solventar sus estudios trabaja en el transporte de pasajeros, este Sindicato cuenta con diferentes paradas en la zona donde brinda servicio de transporte de  pasajeros a diferentes zonas, la tarifa de los pasajes es fija dependiendo de las distancias de recorrido, también presta servicio técnico de celulares, en una tienda donde esta empleado los fines de semanas, para generar mayores ingresos directos, ahora él quiere  activar una tienda propia así tendrá mayores ingresos, y para esto necesita un pequeño capital para la compra de los repuestos de celulares.
texts.en: Humberto, 23, is from Cliza. He is single and has no children. He has been living away from his parents since he left for the city 4 years ago to study techniques for repairing cellular phones. He is in his second semester of university studies in systems engineering. In order to pay his educational expenses, he transports passengers. His union has passenger stops throughout the area and offers service to other areas. The fares are fixed according to the length of the trip. He also offers cellular repair services in a shop where he works on weekends to earn more income. He wants to open his own store to increase his income and needs some capital to buy parts for cellular phones.

loans.use: to buy parts for cellular phones.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
This is Leonila, 54, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Virgilio, her business partner, and she is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Leonila operates a vegetable farm. She grows vegetables and other fruits on their farm located in Cavite. It is located in the high lands where it is suitable for growing vegetables and other fruits. She sells her products to the market and fruit stores. She regularly supplies them and to the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1000 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and plants for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Leonila dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and plants for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Lewelyn

texts.en:
This is Lewelyn, who previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she utilized to purchase farm inputs needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

Lewelyn would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and other tools for the maintenance of the farm. Her business profits will definitely help her to sustain the family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lewelyn dreams of being able to give her children a good quality education and hopes to have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farming materials and other supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Katlyn

texts.en:
This is Katlyn.  She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. Having more items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

Katlyn hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of giving her child a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Severo

texts.es: EL SEÑOR SEVERO, es una persona de 49 años de edad de estado civil casado, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, vive en su propio domicilio, cuenta con tres dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus hijos; la actividad económica a la que se dedica él y su familia es la producción agrícola; producen papa, haba, arveja y zanahoria en sus propias parcelas los mismos se hallan situadas en la comunidad de Pairumani del municipio de Tíraque distante desde la ciudad de Cochabamba sobre la carretera antigua a Santa Cruz en el Km. 90. Y finalmente el cliente y su esposa manifiestan tener el deseo de incrementar el número cabezas de sus ganados bovinos y para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital  de inversión para realizar la compra de los mismos y de tal forma a mediano plazo obtener ingresos económicos adicionales a partir de la venta de los ganados.
texts.en:
Severo, 49, is married and completed elementary school.  He lives in his own house and has three economic dependents in his care, his children.  His and his family’s economic activity is agriculture.  They grow potatoes, lima beans, peas and carrots on their own land located in the community of Pairumani in Tíraque Municipality which a distance from the city of Cochabamba located along the old Santa Cruz highway at about the 90 kilometer marker.  

Both Severo and his wife state that they’d like to increase the size of their cattle herd and to do so they need to request investment funds to buy them so that in the medium-run they will be able to earn additional income when they sell the cattle.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Idrissa from Waterloo in the eastern area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is married with three children between the ages of 3 and 14 years old. Two of his children are currently attending school. In 2001, Idrissa established his local food commodities business within a busy market area. He began his business because he comes from the village and he was not educated in any technical skills. He decided to start his own business. He works at the business every day, expect holidays, seven days per week .He says that the main challenges to his business are the poor road network and lack of enough capital to increase his business.

Idrissa requires a loan in order to buy groundnuts, palm oil, cassava and beans. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to educate his children and improve his standard of living. In the future, Idrissa plans to build a structure for his business and be a supplier to other partners. He thanks you for your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Idrissa from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy groundnuts, palm oil, cassava and beans.

loans.name: Elidelia

texts.en: Elidelia is 60 years old and now a widow. She has five grownup children and they live happily in a rural community. She owns and manages a small variety store to generate income. She has been operating her business for almost 20 years and usually earns a profit of PHP 8,000 a month, which she usually spends for their food, clothing and other expenses at home. Due to the high cost of commodities and transportation, she aims to improve her variety store to increase her income. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional PHP 6,000 to buy bread, junk food, soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, bananas, beans, cabbages, citrus and sweet potatoes to sell. She believes that someday, she will improve the business and make it viable through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy bread, junk food, soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, bananas, beans, cabbages, citrus and sweet potatoes to sell

loans.name: Matea

texts.en:
This is Matea, 61, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She manages her household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Matea operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias, and also a variety of hanging plants. Her regular customers are tourists, neighbors and members from nearby communities.  She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and garden inputs for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Matea dreams to grow her business in the coming years and hopes to live a peaceful life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and garden inputs for her business

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en: Rosela, 62, is married and has three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Rosela owns and operates a farming business to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP. Rosela has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer. She been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en: Benedict is 33 years old and still single. He aims to become financially stable before he settles down. To generate income, he put up a small variety store in their village, selling grocery items, fruits and vegetables. He has been operating the business for almost three years and usually earns a profit of P8,000 a month that he usually spends for his necessities and also uses to help his parents in financing the education of his younger brothers. He plans to improve the business to increase his income. Due to insufficient capital, he is asking for a loan of P6,000 to buy additional stocks of grocery items, fruits and vegetables for sale. He hopes that someday, he will expand the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of grocery items, fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo is from Sebasi, Clarin. He is 50 years old, married and has three children. To make a living, Ricardo has cultivated coconuts for 12 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Ricardo joined GDMPC. He is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to pay labor costs for land plowing. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to pay labor costs for land plowing

loans.name: Renan

texts.en:
This is Renan, 36, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Single, he manages his household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for everyday expenses.  

Renan operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to factories and others of the like. Renan's regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 16,000 loan. He will be incorporating the loan into his current revolving fund used to buy trash from collectors. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Renan hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being successful in life through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more recycled materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is married and has 7 children. She is 45 years old, and lives in Capucao, Ozamis City, in the Philippines. For the past 10 years she has been planting, harvesting and selling bananas for a living. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000. Fe has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This year, she joined GDMPC and hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Francisco Aureliano

texts.es:
EL socio pertenece al banco comunal MARIA AUXILIADORA,el banco esta ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,provincia de Cusco y departamente de Cusco.
El socio Francisco tiene 58 años,casado y tiene 06 hijos,el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de accesorios de vehiculos,el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,el socio vende lo que son llantas,timones,retrovisores entre otros,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el credito para la compra de llantas para su negocio.
EL socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Francisco, 58, is a member of the “María Auxiliadora” communal bank located in Cusco District, Cusco Province and Department.  He has six children and alternates his daily chores with a business selling auto parts.  He’s been in business for years and does well thanks to the effort he puts into it daily.  He sells tires, steering wheels, rear-view mirrors, among others.  He’s a responsible, dedicated person who supports his family this way.  He’s requesting the loan to buy tires for his business.  He feels grateful for the granted loan and commits to make his scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
EL socio pertenece al banco comunal MARIA AUXILIADORA,el banco esta ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,provincia de Cusco y departamente de Cusco.

El socio Efrain tiene 68 años,separado y tiene 01 hijo,el socio alterna sus actividades diarias brindando el servicio de taxi,el socio lleva años en este trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,el socio trabaja todos los dias desde las 06:00am hasta las 06:00pm aproximadamente este horario puede variar de acuerdo a la actividad que pueda realizar durante el dia ya que su trabajo es independiente, el socio es una persona responsable y empeños siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.


El socio solicita el credito para realizar el cambio de llantas para su carro.

EL socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Efraín, 68, is a member of the “María Auxiliadora” communal bank located in Cusco District, Cusco Province and Department.  He has one son and alternates his daily chores with a business providing taxi services.  He’s been in business for years and does well thanks to the effort he puts into it daily.  He works every day from 6am until 6pm approximately but the schedule can vary according to the activity he may do daily since he works independently.  He’s a responsible, dedicated man who supports his family this way.  He requests the loan to replace the tires on his car. He feels grateful for the granted loan and commits to make his scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna tiene 53 años, convive con Pedro, con quien tiene 8 hijos, pero vive con uno de ellos: Jhon. Ellos habitan una casa propia que construyeron con esmero, y se ubica en un distrito agrícola. Reyna se dedica a la agricultura y a la venta de verduras. Ya son como 30 años los que lleva trabajando. Al lado de su esposo Pedro se dirige hacia sus cultivos y los atiende. Ellos siembran papas de distintas variedades, arbejas y otras hortalizas. Dichos productos los traslada hasta el mercado mayorista de Tarma, principalmente los días de ferias (jueves y domingos). Le va muy bien, pues en todos estos años aprendió a comercializar con inteligencia.  “El trabajo en el campo es cansado pero ya me acostumbré y si un día no trabajo me siento incómoda”, menciona. Sus hijos mayores también la ayudan en el trabajo pesado de la agricultura. Así Reyna y Pedro viven en armonía con la mentalidad de seguir creciendo. Éste es su crédito número 8 con MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Se siente contenta de pertenecer tantos años a un banco comunal de personas responsables y solidarias. Esta vez destinará los 2000 soles solicitados en la compra de abonos orgánicos como guano de corral, lo sobrante (500 soles) los empleará en la compra de semillas de arvejas.
texts.en:
Reyna, 53, lives with Pedro with whom she has 8 children but only one of them, Jhon, still lives with them.  They live in a house they built with much effort located in an agricultural district.  Reyna works in agriculture and selling vegetables.  She’s been working about 30 years now.  Along with her husband, Pedro, she heads out to the crops and cares for them.  

They plant a variety of potatoes, peas and other vegetables.  Said products are then transported all the way to the Tarma wholesale market, especially on market days (Thursday and Sunday).  She does very well because she’s learned throughout the years to trade intelligently.  “Work in the field is tiring but I’m used to it and if I don’t work a day I feel uncomfortable,” she mentions.  Her older children also help with the heavier tasks.  Thus, Reyna and Pedro live in harmony with the idea in mind of continuing to grow.

This is her 8th MFP loan and she commits to make her monthly payments punctually.  She feels happy to have belonged to her communal bank of responsible, supportive people for so many years.  This time she will earmark the requested 2000 soles to buy organic manure like barnyard guano and what’s left over (500 soles) she’ll use to buy pea seeds.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Joseph from Waterloo in the eastern area of Freetown. He is married with three children between the ages of 10 months and 8 years.  One of his children attends school. He began his business because he did not go to school and he lost his parent at the age of nine. 

Joseph runs a general merchandise store where he sells beans, groundnuts, palm oil and gari.  He has been running this business for three years. He works at the business every day expect holidays. He does not have any other source of income. Joseph says that at present he is facing insufficient capital to run his business.

Joseph has requested a loan to buy more local foodstuffs like beans, groundnuts, palm oil and gari.  The extra income from this loan will allow him to educate his children. In the future, he plans to expand his business and build a house. He thanks you for your support!

video.title: Kiva Borrower Joseph from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy more local foodstuffs like beans, groundnuts, palm oil and gari.

loans.name: Komba

texts.en:
Komba is 40 years old and married with four children between the ages of 2 and 12 years old. He runs a pharmacy at Waterloo in the eastern area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. Three of his children are currently attending school. 

He's been in this business for 18 years and sells oral hydration salt (ORS) injections, malarial drugs and blood syrup at his store. His business is the only income he has. He says that his business has improved but he has insufficient capital to invest in his business. 

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more drugs like oral hydration salt (ORS) injections, malarial drugs and blood syrup. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him educate his children and increase his business. In the future, he would like to open a clinic and build a big house. He is grateful for your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Komba from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy more drugs like oral hydration salt (ORS) injection, malarial drugs and blood syrup.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn, 43 years old, is a married entrepreneur from Nailon, Tudela with three children and is earning a living from her transport service business. It has been in existence for almost 2 years now and she earns 6,000 PHP a month. To improve business, she is borrowing the amount of 6,500 PHP to obtain accessories and tires, from GDMPC micro credit which she just joined in 2011. Before long, she’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Rizalina works hard to support her family.

She has a mango business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store.  Rizalina is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional mango to sell for her business.

Rizalina has been sustaining her business activities through the past three years with loans from NWTF. She hopes her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more mango to sell.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Collana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTA ROSA DE COLLANA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Remigia ella es casada y tiene 50 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de animlaes como cuyes,gallinas y chanchos,la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados,la socia también se dedica a la agricultura,la socia tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra papa y maíz y también lo vende en el mercado,la socia en su negocio de crianza de animales y negocio de agricultura tiene 7 años,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes, gallinas y chanchos y también para comprar alimentos para los animales. 
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo despues la foto porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo y la socia que esta tapada su cara con un circulo ya no pertenece al banco comunal Santa Rosa de Collana.
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de juguetes, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de servicio de taxi, negocio de restaurant y negocio de venta de comida.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Santa Rosa de Collana” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.

One of the members is Remigia, 50.  She’s married and has six children.  She works in her business raising animals like guinea pigs, chickens and pigs.  She fattens them up and then sells them in various markets.  She also works in agriculture.  She has a field where she grows potatoes and corn she also sells in the market.  She’s been in the animal raising and in the agriculture business for about 7 years and by means of them is able to support her children.  Her dream is to have a locale in which to sell her animals.  She’s requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs, chicks and pigs and also to buy feed for the animals.  Remigia is grateful to those who share her dream this way and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.  The other members work selling toys, groceries, provide taxi services, run a restaurant and sell food.

The members who are in the photo attached to the group photo took the photo later because they requested permission due to work.  The woman with her face covered with a circle is no longer a member of the Santa Rosa de Collana communal bank.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chicks and pigs and also to buy feed for them.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Zainab from Waterloo in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of 3 and 12 years old .Her children are currently going to school.

Zainab runs a plastic rubber business at her store. She sells plastic and rubber dishes, cups, and cooking bowls. She has been running this business for eight years. She works at the business from 7:30 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says her business is the only source of income she has. She says that the main challenges to her business are price fluctuation and transportation costs.

Zainab has requested a loan in order to buy plastic dishes, cups, and cooking bowls. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and renovate her house. In the future, she plans to build her own store and become a wholesaler. She appreciates your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Zainab from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy dishes, cups, and cooking bowls.

loans.name: Diane

texts.en:
After earning a Master of Arts in Early Childhood Education from New York University, Diane started looking for a unique way to combine her passion for theater with her background in education. She founded Pantomina nine months ago. Pantomina is a program that combines Spanish as a second language with appropriate socialization skills through theatrical techniques such as pretend play character development, personality projection and emotional expression. She currently has 10 students between the ages of 18 months and 3 years. 

The biggest challenge for Diane has been promoting her work and getting more children and parents into her program. As a start-up, the business needs to improve its educational tools and equipment in order to increase its capacity and quality. She will use the loan to buy new equipment such as a computer with a digital station for the children and a six-seat stroller to carry students around the neighborhood.  Support Diane in her goal of developing children's personality through theater!

loans.use: to purchase a computer and stroller

loans.name: Merenciana

texts.en: Merenciana is from Pantaon, Ozamis City. She is 61 years old, married and has three children. To make a living, Merenciana has raised pigs to sell for 8 years and earns 8,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Merenciana joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy feeding supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and owns a green grocer, which she has been operating for five years. In this business, Esther sells greens, fruits,and vegetables. 

Esther is applying for a loan of KES 73,050 to buy vegetables wholesale and tomatoes.   She learned about Milango through a friend with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenge she is facing is that some customers do not pay on time.

The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business. Her plans for the future are to start other businesses.

loans.use: To buy vegetables wholesale and tomatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy handicrafts for selling

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a 24-year-old entrepreneur born and raised in Miami who has been into fitness all his life. He has always strived to lead a healthy lifestyle and his passion is to help others improve their fitness and well-being. Jonathan strongly believes that fitness makes people’s lives better. 

Driven by this passion, Jonathan opened a gym that focuses on personal training, classes and a healthy lifestyle. Conquer Fitness is a CrossFit affiliated gym and has been growing exponentially. Jonathan feels proud to have already hired three employees who are working in Conquer Fitness to pay for college. One of his goals is to continue hiring more students.  As Conquer Fitness grows in clientele, the business needs more equipment and space. Jonathan is seeking a loan that will help him to expand, buy new machines and make some renovations to the existing space. This loan will help Jonathan to expand his vision of fitness, health and well-being in his community, improving people’s lives and creating jobs.

loans.use: to purchase new equpiment and pay for removations

loans.name: Agron

texts.en:
Agron is thirty-six years old and lives in the northern Albania.  His family was persecuted during the communist era and he was raised under such circumstances. Agron is looking after his brother’s children who were orphaned long ago. The reason he is working so hard, he said, is because he wants to give the nephews and nieces a good life and education.

For the past 12 years, his primary focus has been on livestock husbandry (cows and goats) and he has been successful at it. Agron has been selling milk, baby calves, and goats to the locals and has bought modern equipment for milking the animals. Being happy with the earning, Agron is planning to expand  this business further in the very near future.

At the moment, Agron is requesting a loan from VisionFund Albania through Kiva to help him build a stable for the animals before the bitter winter that his region is faced with, kicks in. Agron wants to assure each lender that he will pay the loan back on time with no doubt. 

Agron is photographed here with the machinery he uses to milk the animals.

loans.use: To build a stable for the animals before winter kicks in.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business making and selling white cheese in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients to make cheese.

NWTF is listing Gloria's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make cheese

loans.name: Anaclita

texts.en: This time, Anaclita is borrowing a Php 18,000 to buy more bamboo to sell to her customers.  The general store business that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA, continues to provide for Anaclita and her family and that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to sell.

loans.name: Rafiqan

texts.en:
Rafiquen is 54 years old and is a dedicated mother of five children. She is efficiently doing a business of selling milk and cattle rearing for many years. She has 3 buffaloes and 2 cows. She purchases calves and sells them near the Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries like Pakistan ). She serves well in her community and has gained many customers. She is also able to fulfill the needs of her children. 

Her husband is employed in a small general store and does not make enough to cover the everyday expenditures of his family members alone. That is why Rafiquen is working hard to support her family. At present, she requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy one more cow to cater for more customers. She is hopeful to earn more by increasing in the sales of milk. Rafiquen wishes to send her children to school for their better future.

loans.use: To purchase one more cow to increase milk sales.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 53 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her business.

Rosalia has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from ready-to-wear and firewood retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is 52 years old and a businessman.  He is married to Lydia, a mixed crop farmer. They are blessed with three children. He has been selling building materials like sand and stones for the past ten years.  He earns a monthly income of KES 18,500, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Elias will use the loan to buy more stocks of construction materials. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a lorry for transporting the materials.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of construction materials

loans.name: Joanna

texts.en: Joanna is an architect and designer living in Brooklyn. She has a part-time job at an architecture firm, but her real passion is design. She spends the other half of her time designing and selling astronomy-themed baby curtains from her home.  The inspiration for her product, The Twinkle Curtain™, came after she had her first child and started experimenting with curtain design at home. After seeing her curtains, Joanna’s friends became interested in purchasing them so she began selling small batches. She has recently begun taking small batch orders at boutiques in New York and has received orders from online retailers. In response to these orders, Joanna started producing larger quantities of the product. Joanna feels lucky to have the support of her friends and family who are helping her with production expenses, but is seeking a loan to finish paying for the remaining production costs to cover the orders and prepare for new distributors. Joanna hopes that one day she can dedicate her entire time to work on her passion and spend time with her husband and two children.

loans.use: to pay for production costs for manufacturing curtains

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Due to financial difficulty, Amalia and her husband aimed to improve their source of income to satisfy their necessities and continue sending their seven children to school. They want them to finish a degree so that they will find a good job someday. She engages in buying and selling fruits, vegetables and soft brooms in their community while her husband cultivates their farmland. Sometimes, they experienced hardships and difficulties in life due to calamities and the high cost of commodities and school fees. Despite this, they have the determination to improve the business. Amalia is asking for additional capital of PHP 6,000 to buy bananas, ginger, beans, cabbages, sweet potatoes and soft brooms to sell. She believes that this loan will enable her to improve the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy bananas, ginger, beans, cabbages, sweet potatoes and soft brooms to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 42 years old, married with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Sarah has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Sarah requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Sarah has been in this business for five years. In the future, Sarah would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
This is Editha, who is 52 years old and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Danilo, a bus conductor, and mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Editha maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. 

A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the customer's catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Editha hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of having a good life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Viviana is 45 years old and married, with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Viviana is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Viviana has been raising pigs for four years.  She also earns additional income from food vending and firewood retail.

She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo Noe desde hace 7 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos: Zaraí de 9 y Jesús de 4 años. Ellos habitan una casa propia que Betty y Noe construyeron con esmero y se ubica en un anexo agrícola. Betty es una mujer luchadora. Se dedica a la agricultura desde los 20 años. Es así que se dedica  a la siembra de papa, maíz y arveja. Sus conocimientos los debe a sus padres quienes le enseñaron a cultivar la tierra. Gracias a su esfuerzo y la ayuda que hace muchos años MFP le brinda pudo construir su casa, así pudo darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus pequeños hijos.
Betty y su esposo trabajan intensamente en el cultivo de sus productos. “Lo más difícil es tener que ir hasta las alturas porque ahí están mis parcelas y luego trasladar la cosecha hasta la ciudad”, menciona como mayor inconveniente, pero aún así no se da por vencida y continua trabajando. 
 Betty en el futuro desea sembrar en mayor  cantidad, además tiene planeado abrir una tienda de abarrotes que le ayude a obtener más ingresos económicos. Tiene sus planes claros. Éste es su crédito número 9 con MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Afirma sentirse cómoda con su banco comunal “Santa Cruz de Tapo”, por tener como compañeros a personas responsables.
Betty requiere 2000 soles para adquirir 2 bolsas de semillas de arvejas con 1000 soles y los otros 1000 para comprar bolsas de abonos orgánicos.
texts.en:
Betty is 26 years old and lives with her husband Noe of seven years with whom she has two children: Zarai who is 9 and Jesús who is 4 years old. They live in their own house that Betty and Noe built with care and is located in an agricultural area. Betty is a fighter. She has worked in agriculture for 20 years. She plants potatoes, corn and peas. She owes her knowledge to her parents who talk her to cultivate the land. Thanks to her efforts and the many years of help from MFP she was able to build her house and give her children a better quality of life. 

Betty and her husband work intensely growing their products. "The most difficult thing is to have to go up so high because that is where my land is, and then have to transport the harvest to the city", she mentions as her greatest inconvenience. But still, she has not let herself be defeated and continues working. In the future Betty hopes to plant a greater quantity of crops and she plans to open a grocery store that would help to obtain greater earnings. She has clear plans.

This is her ninth loan with MFP and is committed to being punctual with her monthly loan installments. She affirms that she feels comfortable in her communal bank "Santa Cruz de Tapo" because she has partners who are responsible. Betty needs 2000 soles to acquire two bags of pea seeds with 1000 soles and the other 1000 soles will be used to buy bags of organic fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Isabel De Jutacaj Group

texts.es:
La señora Eva esta casada, tiene 27 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos 2n de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la crianza de animales domésticos, inicio este negocio criando pollos y gallina ponedoras, y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la venta de relojes.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de cerdos y la compra de alimento para los mismo, espera en el futuro tener una granja de varios animales. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de animales y a la venta de relojes.
texts.en:
Eva is 27 and married. She did not have the opportunity to study. She has three children, two of whom are studying, and she makes a living by breeding domestic animals. She began this business by breeding chickens and laying hens, and now has 5 years of experience. She has the help of her husband, who sells clocks for a living. 

She has organized a group and is requesting a loan which she will use to buy pigs and pig feed. In the future she hopes to have a farm with various animals. The other members of the group make a living by breeding animals and selling clocks.

loans.use: to buy pigs for breeding

loans.name: Laura

texts.en: After losing her job during the economic crisis in 2008, Laura decided to invest the little savings she had into opening her own business. Although she has worked in various fields since moving to the United States 11 years ago, she worked as a seamstress for 20 years in her home country of Argentina. Keeping in mind her passion for clothes, Laura decided to open her own sewing shop called Alteration by Laura Co., which does general alterations for all types of clothes for men and women. She loves what she does and her dream is to design wedding dresses. In order to accomplish her goal, Laura needs to purchase equipment to increase the quality of her clothes and start sewing wedding dresses. Help Laura start her path to becoming a successful wedding dress designer!

loans.use: to purchase new equipment

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en: Precilla is 63 years old, widowed, and has 10 children. Precilla works very hard to provide for them. Precilla runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store. Precilla has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as bread, sugar, canned goods, and other groceries. In the future Precilla would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a 25-year-old, businessman. He is a single man but supports his parents. He has been selling retail goods like watches, albums, purses, etc. for the past 2 years, with a monthly income of 8,000 KES which he uses to cater for his basic needs. 

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Anthony will use the loan to buy more stocks of watches, albums and torches. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his sibling. His hope and dream is to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of watches, albums and torches

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a 34-year-old businessman. He is married to Judy. They are blessed with one child. He has been selling chairs for the past 9 years, with a monthly income of 15,000 KES which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Thomas will use the loan to buy more chairs. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his child. His hope and dream is to buy a pickup for transporting chairs to his customers.

loans.use: to buy more chairs for sale.

loans.name: Esther Gimena

texts.es: Esther estudio hasta cuarto de secundaria, culmino sus estudios con mucha dificultad por necesidades económicas de su familia, actualmente tiene dos niñas, es madre soltera el padre de las niñas los abandono, reciben apoyo económico muy bajo de parte del padre de las niñas, para poder seguir adelante con sus dos niñas, Esther realiza diferentes trabajos inicio con la venta de refrescos en la reuniones en los sindicatos, luego realizo una mayor inversión vendiendo comida, trato de buscar mas mercado fue a las reuniones de los sindicatos aledaños y luego a eventos un poco mas grandes como ferias y actividades sociales como promociones y otros, luego de un tiempo se animo a trabajar como rescatista llevando naranja a Cochabamba, tiene tres años de experiencia en esta actividad, el crédito será utilizado como capital de operación para poder trasladar naranja a la ciudad de Cochabamba, la cliente busca siempre seguir adelante por sus hijas y su familia.
texts.en:
Esther studied until the fourth grade of secondary school. She ended her studies with much difficulty due to the economic necessities of her family. Now, she has two daughters. She is a single mother. The father of the girls abandoned them. They receive very little economic support from the father of the girls. To be able to get ahead with her two daughters, Esther works different jobs. She began with the sale of soft drinks in union meetings, and then made a greater investment selling food. She tried to find a greater market. She went to the border union meetings and soon to slightly larger events like fairs and social activities like promotions and others. Soon after, she inspired herself to work as an agricultural intermediary bringing oranges to Cochabamba. She has three years of experience in this activity.

The loan will be used as operations capital to be able to transport oranges to the city of Cochabamba. The client seeks to always to get ahead for her daughters and her family.

loans.use: to buy operations capital.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years. Aileen earns more income from general store.

Aileen is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. Aileen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
